ranked_diseases.explanation: Perfect match with reference cases showing identical phenotypes of shortened QT interval and paroxysmal atrial fibrillation. SQTS3 is caused by KCNJ2 mutations.
SQTS1 (KCNH2 mutations) presents with shortened QT interval and can have atrial fibrillation, though the specific combination is less commonly reported than in SQTS3.
SQTS2 (KCNQ1 mutations) can present with shortened QT interval and arrhythmias, though paroxysmal atrial fibrillation is less typical than in SQTS3.
SQTS4 involves CACNA1C mutations and shortened QT interval, but atrial fibrillation is less commonly associated compared to other SQTS subtypes.
SQTS5 (CACNB2 mutations) presents with shortened QT interval but atrial fibrillation is rarely reported in this subtype.
KCNA5 mutations can cause early-onset atrial fibrillation, though shortened QT interval is not a typical feature, making this less likely.
